page.title: 09SCHOOL ORGANISATION
page.content: Children are either Infants (5-7) or Juniors (7-11). Infants all work in the Infants room. Lower Juniors and Upper Juniors are divided between the Head and the 5/10 teacher every morning for basic subjects. All Juniors come together in one room with the Head every afternoon for music, drama, art, creative writing, sports and project work. There is a real family atmosphere, parents, grandparents and friends constantly visit and help in classes. Every child is treated as an individual; modern, progressive and non-authoritarian teaching methods are used. the school has teachers visiting from other schools to observe maths being taught and in 1985 we won the Sussex Rural Community Council shield for our environmental project work.
